intro: Silene prolifera, commonly known as the clustered campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to red flowers and succulent-like stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually opposite and linear, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Silene prolifera is often found in open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and rocky slopes.
